review_title: Meaningful work and the opportunity to make a difference with competitive pay
job_title: Director of Marketing and Development in Middletown, RI
pros: I worked at Newport Mental Health for three years between Jan 2020 and Dec 2022. During that time the organization doubled in size. As with any organization that is in a growth mode, it means there is tons of opportunity for anyone with initiative and vision who wants to move things forward. I found the organization's administrative team to be creative in it's thinking about problem solving, and this is why I joined the team. Those inside the industry know that it's a exciting time to be in mental health because of a confluence of factors. The clinical labor market is incredibly tight, yet funding is plentiful. The public spotlight is on mental health which creates opportunity and accountability. The clinical work and outcomes are literally life or death, and it's a community based organization so you don't have the distance from outcomes that you'd expect at a larger company. I found the work incredibly meaningful, and all-encompassing. Which is what a community deserves from leaders at a community mental health center. I highly recommend Newport Mental Health.
cons: Because of rapid growth, the organization is short on physical space and is in the process of securing additional space for employees who work in the office.

job_title: Health Care Data Analyst in Newport, RI
pros: Only good thing about this position is some of the coworkers. Hybrid option.
cons: As a non-profit company, it's way behind in diversity and exclusion. As a BIPOC female, I faced racism and passive-aggressive comments about how my food smelled. Management has favorites when it comes to the team members. Aside from that, there is no onboarding Training and you are expected to know everything without any KT session. Even if you do your best you never get recognition or significant growth in the salary. if you try to speak up your opinion is immediately shot down, they aren't open to any advice or input.
Crazy case loads 50 clients always getting more. not offered a raise till Putting notice in.

job_title: Case Worker/Vocational Specialist in Middletown, RI
pros: Co-workers were nice and so were the clients.
cons: No training or supervision given to those who go into this job.  I worked at the Valley Rd office with adults and I would have 45 if not more clients at one time.  They woils care more about productivity and getting paid from insurance companies rather than helping those clients that actually needed it. The two higher ups there like to pick on people and if you are on their "radar" as everyone there calls it, you're screwed.  The pay is horrible for how much work you do and what they tell you to do.  You never get recognition for doing a good job, just looked down on for your mistakes.  If you have a situation you need assistance to handle, no supervisor will help you and they will tell you to figure it out.  They don't care if you burn yourself out working and going above and beyond.
